title: Uninstall OO Containerized on OCP
content:
To uninstall OO Containerized on OpenShift, perform the following tasks:

Delete the OO deployment

  1. Log on to the bastion node, and navigate to the OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT) installation directory: 
    cd $CDF_HOME/bin
  2. Run the following command to remove the OO release: 
    ./helm uninstall <OO RELEASE NAME> -n <OO NAMESPACE>
    Where:
    <OO RELEASE NAME> is the OO release that you want to uninstall, which you can get by running the command ./helm list -n <OO NAMESPACE>.
    <OO NAMESPACE> is the namespace where you installed OO.
  3. Run the following command to remove the OO deployment: 
    cd $CDF_HOME/scripts
./cdfctl.sh deployment delete -d <OO DEPLOYMENT NAME>
    Where:
    <OO DEPLOYMENT NAME> is the name you specified for the deployment you created to install OO.
    For example: 
    ./cdfctl.sh deployment delete -d oo-prod

    You must enter the administrator password you set during the OMT installation.

Remove persistent volume and claims

If you created the volumes.yaml sample file as documented in the Prepare persistent volumes and claims for OO step, run the following command to delete the persistent volumes:

kubectl delete -f <claims.yaml path>
kubectl delete -f <volumes.yaml path>

For example:

kubectl delete -f oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/samples/persistent_storage/claims.yaml
kubectl delete -f oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/samples/persistent_storage/volumes.yaml

Clean the databases

When you uninstall OO, the databases residing in the external PostgreSQL databases aren't removed. You need to remove the databases manually.

If you used different names when creating the databases and database users for OO components, replace the default names below with the actual names you used. 

  1. Connect to the Postgres server with the command below: 
    psql -h <host> -p <port> -U <PostgreSQL admin>
  2. Delete all the OO databases by running the following commands: 
    # drop databases
drop database oocentraldb;
drop database oouidb;
drop database oocontrollerdb;
drop database ooschedulerdb;
drop database aplsdb;
  3. Delete all the OO database users by running the following commands: 
    # drop users
drop role oocentraldbuser;
drop role oouidbuser;
drop role oocontrollerdbuser;
drop role ooscheduler;
drop role aplsdbuser;
